#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Free Your Mind and Think

#Text=When we say ' mind ' we think of : consciousness , awareness , cognitive thinking , reasoning , perception ; but also of : intuition , subconscious gibberish , or unconscious strata that influences our lives and the way of behavior .
#Text=The nature of mind or the matrix of various patterns that forms around a soul is closely related to the Buddhist concept of karma .
#Text=Free your mind and start thinking !
#Text=Steps
#Text=Awaken .
#Text=Become aware of how your environment influences your brain .
#Text=A healthy brain has some 200 billion neurons .
#Text=Conscious mind controls our brain only 5 % of the day , the subconscious mind has control of our thoughts 95 % of the time .
#Text=' Man lives his life in sleep , and in sleep he dies ' were words of Gurdjieff who was encouraging his spiritual students to awake and transcend to a higher state of consciousness .
#Text=Become mindful .
#Text=Mindfulness works with continuous awareness of body , thoughts , emotions , intentions , actions .
#Text=Through bare attention , we learn to see things as they really are , without judgments and preconceptions .
#Text=Mindfulness brings awareness of the moment of ' Now ' .
#Text=We become aware of all that surrounds the process or act we perform .
#Text=Buddhists use mindfulness as one of the main spiritual development tools .
#Text=The following exercises practice mindfulness :
#Text=Eat mindfully .
#Text=Be aware of every bit you take , of smells , of texture of the food , of hunger within your body .
#Text=Chew slowly , observing yourself eating .
#Text=Walk mindfully .
#Text=Feel your body moving through the air , your feet touching the ground , your hands moving , listen to your breathing .
#Text=Observe yourself walking .
#Text=Stay ' awake ' during the process
#Text=Talk mindfully .
#Text=Be conscious of your words and the way you utter them .
#Text=Be conscious of emotions that are linked to certain words .
#Text=Consciously take a different ' side ' in an argument that you usually have with your friends .
#Text=This change of roles , will give you an insight about words and their power .
#Text=Wash dishes mindfully .
#Text=Chose an activity that you do every day , such as ' washing dishes ' , and do it the best you can , taking care of every single detail , doing it perfect .
#Text=Your search for perfection will exercise mindfulness within this ' every-day 's act .
#Text=Meditate .
#Text=Still your mind .
#Text=A human brain has 70,000 thoughts per day .
#Text=Train to be silent , in that way you will attempt to train this amazing machine called brain .
#Text=You will direct its force into concentration , inspiration , innovation instead of wasting your time and energy in useless chatter .
#Text=Meditation is a major inspirational tool of many philosophies .
#Text=Understand and take care of your body .

#Text=Proper nutrition , proper exercises , walks in nature , fresh air , they all contribute to stress-less life style that is necessary to keep the hormones and the chemistry within our body in balance .
#Text=Within Hinduism , to ' free ' one 's mind it is recommended to have a sentient diet , the diet that does not in any way disturb the body or the mind .
#Text=This would mean avoiding meat consumption , avoiding alcohol and drugs , avoiding too spicy food , etc.
#Text=Understand and transform your feelings .
#Text=The power of changing oneself lies in the body and in the feelings .
#Text=Understanding and transforming the feelings from negative to positive , gives us strength and inspiration to live a happier and more fulfilled life .
#Text=Distinguish feelings and thoughts that are not yours but the product of mass marketing and socially established norms .
#Text=Ask yourself , what makes me happy ?
#Text=This answer usually carry the glimpse into your Soul , your true needs and feelings .
#Text=Spend more time exercising compassion , peace , friendliness .
#Text=These qualities will free your mind .
#Text=Challenge your core beliefs .
#Text=Core beliefs are at the very essence of how we perceive ourselves , and the world around us .
#Text=Core beliefs are rigid , hard and inflexible .
#Text=Core beliefs are sentences and words that are repeated so many times that they became our truth .
#Text=Our core beliefs are at the root of our happiness or unhappiness , our high or low self-esteem , our destiny .
#Text=If we change our beliefs , we can hope to change our reality .
#Text=Often we try our best to be ‘ liked ’ complying with the current ‘ norm ’ .
#Text=This could lead to a major flow of dishonesty about ones true feelings and thoughts .
#Text=Chose any of the following exercises to ‘ break ’ the chains of media and society that are tightly woven around your neck :
#Text=Go walking backwards
#Text=Stop next to the street music player and start dancing and singing with him
#Text=Go to a nudist beach
#Text=Stop to talk with strangers
#Text=If in a crowded street , just stop and observe the crowd moving next to you
#Text=Read inspiring and spiritual books .
#Text=Read inspiring and self-development books .
#Text=Use poetry as spiritual tool .
#Text=Read philosophy .
#Text=Read books from people you admire .
#Text=Read books from various gurus and mystics of the past .
#Text=Think creatively , think freely .
#Text=Learning the skill of creativity is about learning to challenge the existing , and learning to trust one ’s idea .
#Text=Creativity is an essential ingredient of one 's self development .
#Text=Ask questions .
#Text=Ask yourself questions about meaning of life and purpose of your life , about environment and the way we live on the Planet Earth with other living beings .
#Text=Ask , what can be done better and were is your role within this amazing matrix .
#Text=Tips
#Text=There is a Buddhist saying : ' Before enlightenment he gathered wood and carried water ; after enlightenment he gathered wood and carried water . '
#Text=The difference in two states of mind is in awareness .
#Text='
#Text=We are what we repeatedly do .
#Text=Excellence , then , is not an act , but a habit . '
#Text=Aristotle
